TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit TarFile extends System.Object
public ref class TarFile abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides static methods for creating and extracting tar archives.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CreateFromDirectory (string sourceDirectoryName, System.IO.Stream destination, bool includeBaseDirectory);
.method public static hidebysig void CreateFromDirectory(string sourceDirectoryName, class System.IO.Stream destination, bool includeBaseDirectory) cil managed
Public Shared Sub CreateFromDirectory (sourceDirectoryName As String, destination As Stream, includeBaseDirectory As Boolean)
static member CreateFromDirectory : string * System.IO.Stream * bool -> unit
public: static void CreateFromDirectory(System::String ^ sourceDirectoryName, System::IO::Stream ^ destination, bool includeBaseDirectory);

Docs.param: The path of the directory to archive.
to include the base directory name as the first segment in all the names of the archive entries. to exclude the base directory name from the archive entry names.
Docs.summary: Creates a tar stream that contains all the filesystem entries from the specified directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CreateFromDirectory (string sourceDirectoryName, string destinationFileName, bool includeBaseDirectory);
.method public static hidebysig void CreateFromDirectory(string sourceDirectoryName, string destinationFileName, bool includeBaseDirectory) cil managed
Public Shared Sub CreateFromDirectory (sourceDirectoryName As String, destinationFileName As String, includeBaseDirectory As Boolean)
static member CreateFromDirectory : string * string * bool -> unit
public: static void CreateFromDirectory(System::String ^ sourceDirectoryName, System::String ^ destinationFileName, bool includeBaseDirectory);

Docs.param: The path of the directory to archive.
The path of the destination archive file.
to include the base directory name as the first path segment in all the names of the archive entries. to exclude the base directory name from the entry name paths.
Docs.summary: Creates a tar file that contains all the filesystem entries from the specified directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ExtractToDirectory (System.IO.Stream source, string destinationDirectoryName, bool overwriteFiles);
.method public static hidebysig void ExtractToDirectory(class System.IO.Stream source, string destinationDirectoryName, bool overwriteFiles) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ExtractToDirectory (source As Stream, destinationDirectoryName As String, overwriteFiles As Boolean)
static member ExtractToDirectory : System.IO.Stream * string * bool -> unit
public: static void ExtractToDirectory(System::IO::Stream ^ source, System::String ^ destinationDirectoryName, bool overwriteFiles);

Docs.param: The stream containing the tar archive.
The path of the destination directory where the filesystem entries should be extracted.
to overwrite files and directories in ; to avoid overwriting, and throw if any files or directories are found with existing names.
Docs.summary: Extracts the contents of a stream that represents a tar archive into the specified directory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Files of type <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Fifo> can only be extracted in Unix platforms.
Elevation is required to extract a <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> to disk.

Docs.exception: Operation not permitted due to insufficient permissions.
Extracting tar entry would have resulted in a file outside the specified destination directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ExtractToDirectory (string sourceFileName, string destinationDirectoryName, bool overwriteFiles);

static member ExtractToDirectory : string * string * bool -> unit
public: static void ExtractToDirectory(System::String ^ sourceFileName, System::String ^ destinationDirectoryName, bool overwriteFiles);

Docs.param: The path of the tar file to extract.
The path of the destination directory where the filesystem entries should be extracted.
to overwrite files and directories in ; to avoid overwriting, and throw if any files or directories are found with existing names.
Docs.summary: Extracts the contents of a tar file into the specified directory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Files of type <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Fifo> can only be extracted in Unix platforms.
Elevation is required to extract a <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> to disk.

Docs.exception: Operation not permitted due to insufficient permissions.
